title: How to Make Chocolate Puffs

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 425°F/220°C.
Sift the flour into a bowl.
Heat the water and butter in a medium saucepan until the butter melts.
Boil the liquid mixture, then remove from heat.
Add the flour all at once and beat quickly.
steps.description: The mixture should become thick and glossy, leaving the side of the pan clean.

steps.headline: Add the egg to the mixture a little at a time.
Beat by hand using a wooden spoon or an electric mixer.
steps.description: The mixture should become thick and glossy and drop reluctantly from a spoon. This is referred to as the choux pastry.

steps.headline: Spoon the choux pastry into a piping bag, fitted with a ⁄4 inch (1.9 cm) nozzle or
steps.description: Using two teaspoons: scoop a spoonful with one teaspoon and push the batter with the other. Using zip lock bag: fill the zip lock bag with the batter. Cut a hole about ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) wide.

steps.headline: Dampen two baking sheets with cold water.
Pipe walnut-sized spoonfuls (about 1-2 inches in diameter) of choux pastry onto the dampened baking sheets, leaving 1 inch (2.5 cm) space all around.
Cook for 25-30 minutes until they are golden brown and well-risen.
Transfer the puffs onto a wire rack after baking.
Hold the puffs with a clean oven mitt or a thick paper towel.
Make a small hole in each puff with the handle of a wooden spoon.
Cool down.
Whip the cream until thick.
Put it into a piping bag, fitted with a plain or star nozzle.
steps.description: You could use the zip lock bag method here also.)

steps.headline: Push the nozzle into the hold in each puff and squirt a little cream inside.
Make chocolate icing, if you want:
steps.description: Stir the icing sugar and cocoa in a small bowl Slowly, add enough water to make thick glossy icing. Spread a little icing on each puff.

steps.headline: Finished.
